daewoo

It looks like the hurricane is going to do some pretty major damage to the loop and the refineries in Lousiana (maybe hurrican country wasn't the best place to build such things...who knew??).
 
 Might be a good time to fill up the old station wagon. The blood is in the water already as far as gas prices go.
georged

I wonder how current gasoline spikes are going to affect Ford/GM with all their chips on the SUV/truck gamble? Both just moved a lot of inventory using the employee discount theme that had to take a chunk from 2006 new model sales and now the Katrina disaster. 
 
 Neither make significant margin on their somewhat sparse economy offerings with that market going to Toyo and others. Could $100+ for a fill-up mark the demise of inefficient SUVs and light trucks as America's preference for personal transportation? Additional earnings forecast downgrading?
billsco

Could $100+ for a fill-up mark the demise of inefficient SUVs and light trucks as America's preference for personal transportation? 

 
 I hope so, and I want it to be a purely personal choice, not government mandating. 
 
 No one should begrudge a man his pickup truck, a very utilitarian vehicle yet. But SUV's? I'm bothered by them frankly, and I hope this is the beginning of the end for them.
Bassman
I never understood the need for SUVs. Perhaps they are more of a status symbol than anything else. Personally, I'd rather drive something akin to a Chevy Impala or (yechh) a Ford Taurus.
Dzeron

I never understood the need for SUVs. 

 
 Well, I've heard that the demand for Hummers is artificially bolstered by the government tax code.
daewoo

I wonder how current gasoline spikes are going to affect Ford/GM with all their chips on the SUV/truck gamble? Both just moved a lot of inventory using the employee discount theme that had to take a chunk from 2006 new model sales and now the Katrina disaster. 
 
 Neither make significant margin on their somewhat sparse economy offerings with that market going to Toyo and others. Could $100+ for a fill-up mark the demise of inefficient SUVs and light trucks as America's preference for personal transportation? Additional earnings forecast downgrading?

 
 I noticed an add in the paper this weekedn that saud that Chevys current employee pricing scheme has been extended to pckups (previously excluded)
billsco

I noticed an add in the paper this weekedn that saud that Chevys current employee pricing scheme has been extended to pckups (previously excluded)

 
 The employee pricing fad will be a tough one to stop, but is it really that much of a discount? I haven't crunched any numbers because I'm not in the market right now. But when we bought a vehicle for my wife two years ago (who qualified for an employee discount) we were well under any discount scheme very early in the bargaining. It was just flat out pitting dealer against dealer online.
georged

I noticed an add in the paper this weekedn that saud that Chevys current employee pricing scheme has been extended to pckups (previously excluded)

 
 I think Ford/GM are trying to build cash reserves for what could be a tough fall selling season followed by the holiday doldrums. 4th quarter earning forecasts would be interesting reading.
georged

The employee pricing fad will be a tough one to stop, but is it really that much of a discount? I haven't crunched any numbers because I'm not in the market right now. But when we bought a vehicle for my wife two years ago (who qualified for an employee discount) we were well under any discount scheme very early in the bargaining. It was just flat out pitting dealer against dealer online.

 
 I bought a new F350 this past January. Trucks were not heavily discounted to individual buyers. I have personal contacts within the fleet/lessor industries and even that requires a factory order due to demand of trucks. Big SUVs and light trucks are (were?) the only profitable models. The passenger car and small SUV/truck lines are low margin producers.
daewoo

I think Ford/GM are trying to build cash reserves for what could be a tough fall selling season followed by the holiday doldrums. 4th quarter earning forecasts would be interesting reading.

 
 
 Personally I am still convinced that this is just a war for dominance. When you calculate their legacy costs in, they are loosing money on these vehicles that they are selling at the employee discount.
